oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Warren Paint - 1946-02-16 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Warren Paint sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from February 16, 1946. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Lew Childre, Paul Howard and his Arkansas Cotton Pickers, Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys, the Possum Hunters, Clyde Moody, the Bailey Brothers and the Happy Valley Boys, Howdy Forrester, and the Andrews Brothers. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Clyde Moody; Bailey Brothers; Happy Valley Boys; Howdy Forrester; Blue Grass Boys; Andrews Brothers; Paul Howard
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: George D. Hay and Lew Childre introduce Clyde Moody -- Pleading (Clyde Moody) -- Grant Turner announce Opry stars' tour schedules -- George D. Hay introduces the Happy Valley Boys -- Searching For A Soldier's Grave (Bailey Brothers and the Happy Valley Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Howdy Forrester -- Cotton Eyed Joe (Howdy Forrester fiddle, Blue Grass Boys) -- Warren Paint commercial (Grant Turner) -- George D. Hay introduces the Andrews Brothers -- Gonna Lay Down My Old Guitar (Andrews Brothers) -- George D. Hay and Lew Childre introduce Paul Howard -- Fisher's Hornpipe (Paul Howard) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay, Lew Childre, Grant Turner) -- Station announcements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Turner, Grant; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Howard, Paul, 1908-1984; Arkansas Cotton Pickers; Byrd, Billy; Moody, Clyde, 1915-1989; Possum Hunters (Musical group); Bailey Brothers; Happy Valley Boys; Forrester, Howdy, 1922-1987; Andrews Brothers
